tags: and both know that the lone wolf dies and the pack survives
a family that stresses the importance of family
summary: Idk why everyone wants to believe that Sansa and Arya would want to hurt each other like they’ve both been through so much...
body: Idk why everyone wants to believe that Sansa and Arya would want to hurt each other like they’ve both been through so much trauma and lost so much family that even if they hated each other before they would get over it and protect each other

summary: Did you see the got script posts by vanity fair? we really could've had it all :(
question: Did you see the got script posts by vanity fair? we really could've had it all :(
answer: Yes I have seen it. To be more precise, I have only seen the part where Sansa and Arya’s interactions are getting talked about. And honestly? I am not even surprised. Right now I am just waiting for meaningless posts to flood Arya’s tag because I can guarantee you that even after this article, there are people out there who will surely try to attribute all the negativity onto Arya. I mean just think about all the hate that Arya got during s7. The tags were a mess and people called her a mean psychopath who was “threatening her innocent sister” in her own home. They basically turned a blind eye to everything Sansa did. From her sending Brienne away to her going to Bran for the final confirmation about Arya’s “treasons”. Like Sansa would have killed Arya! But of course no one likes to talked about that. Why would they? It will mar the perfect image they have of their favourite.

summary: do you think Arya is as feminist as people say (whether in universe or from a writing perspective)?
question: do you think Arya is as feminist as people say (whether in universe or from a writing perspective)?
answer: In universe she does have a few proto feminist moments (”the woman is important too”). From a writing perspective she is a stock character in the genre but GRRM took a lot of care to make her more human than other Strong Female Characters.

reblog.comment: In universe she does have a few proto feminist moments (”the woman is important too”). From a writing perspective she is a stock character in the genre but GRRM took a lot of care to make her more human than other Strong Female Characters.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: Remember when on the show Arya talks about Sansa liking pretty things and how she had Ned/Cat’s bedroom and Sansa stans accused...
body:
Remember when on the show Arya talks about Sansa liking pretty things and how she had Ned/Cat’s bedroom and Sansa stans accused Arya of being petty and jealous? Well…

Sansa kicking out Brienne because she had to share her with Arya? That’s like the height of pettiness and jealousy, lol! And idiotic to boot, considering how important Brienne was for their safety.

summary: Jonsa fans: Sansa was Jon’s most trusted and no.1 supporter! She is his right hand woman and most trusted Councillor!  The...
body:
Jonsa fans: Sansa was Jon’s most trusted and no.1 supporter! She is his right hand woman and most trusted Councillor!

The Script says:

Jonsa fans: I am an expert in cinematography and been a director for many, many years and look at this lighting coming into the room this way and the way it hits the bed and the way Jon is lying down and Dany is sitting and the way he is looking at her and bottle on the table - all this tells expert me that Jon is deceiving Dany here and fooling her into thinking that he loves her.

The script that the director used to direct that scene says:

blog.name: arabian-bloodstream
blog.title: arabian_bloodstream
blog.description: AdamDriver. MaisieWilliams. JoeDempsie. DemiLovato. KellyClarkson. WashingtonCapitals. TheVampireDiaries. GameofThrones. StarWars. AryaxGendry. Reylo. DamonxElena. Caryl. AryaStark. CarolPeletier.

summary: Dempsie about Gendrya at Con of Thrones  Note: This is from May 2018 -- You should be able to hit play and this should start up...
caption:
Dempsie about Gendrya at Con of Thrones

Note: This is from May 2018 – You should be able to hit play and this should start up right where Joe starts talking about Gendry and Arya at the 16:00 mark. If it doesn’t, well, the Arya/Gendry talk is at about the 16:00 mark. I also transcribed it (as best I could) if you can’t watch the video. The questions are really hard to hear because they didn’t give the audience a microphone. This question was roughly asking Joe about a reunion between Gendry and Arya and she did mention something about the drastic changes in Arya since he’d last seen her.

I mean, I don’t know. I think it would–like, I know there’s an understandable sort of desire for the two characters to meet again. I think it would be really nice for them to–given all that’s happened in the meantime, uhm, particularly for her. I think it’d be great for them to reconnect in some way. Obviously so much, as I said, so much has changed in both of them. Particularly for Arya cuz not only we got to witness her journey through the seasons since, but also, uhm, in terms of how old, you know, thirt–incredibly formative years. She’s grown from a little girl to a young woman. So, I mean, in terms of, yeah, how it will pan out. Who knows I think, I understand everyone’s sort of natural desires to see the two characters reunite somewhere.

The whole video is enjoyable, and for Joe fans, DAYUM, he looks good!!!!!

As for Gendrya, I thought this was pretty positive. There was no going back to the uncomfortable references from before. I also thought it was interesting how he started to say “thirteen” when mentioning her age when she first roughly started on this journey (if that is what he said, it sounded like it to me) and then cut himself off. Make of that what you will. If he did say that, I wonder if it’s because they (being him, GOT’s in general) want to stay away from definitive age counts and such when talking about when we first/last saw Arya and Gendry together.

Also, he casually said that Arya is now a young woman (key word on woman!) Of all word choices to talk about getting that people want to see Arya and Gendry reunite he chose “desire” not once, but twice to begin and end his answer. And he began and ended his statement with the idea that that desire was understandable and natural.

Yeah, I’m taking this one as a win!!! Go Team!Gendrya!! WOOHOO!

blog.name: andloveisenough
blog.title: And Love is Enough
blog.description: “My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.”

summary:
Lol, that Vanity Fair article floating around makes the S7 storylines even worse than I imagined. 

On the other hand, it also...
body:
Lol, that Vanity Fair article floating around makes the S7 storylines even worse than I imagined.

On the other hand, it also shows that these were made for the audience and as such are deceiving. The Littlefinger execution scene initially seems to be from the POV of Arya which shows that she sees that there are too many people for her to kill, only for the scene to then flip and say ‘everyone was in on it all along’. Cersei is initially written at being taken aback by Euron’s supposed betrayal, only for her to tell Jaime this was their plan all along.

Honestly it’s a hot flaming mess but some people are already spouting off the hate.

blog.name: aryajon
blog.title: Arya and Jon
blog.description: This fansite is dedicated to Arya Stark and Jon Snow from the show Game of Thrones and the novel series A Song of Ice and Fire. Tracking #aryajon.

summary: The tensions between Arya and Sansa are also very real (until they’re not). When Arya accuses Sansa of trying to placate the...
caption:
The tensions between Arya and Sansa are also very real (until they’re not). When Arya accuses Sansa of trying to placate the Northern lords to ensure they are on her side, the script explains: “Arya is right. She knows it. We know it. Sansa knows it.” 

- Game of Thrones: 18 Secrets, Easter Eggs, and Revelations Hiding in 7 Seasons of Scripts (Vanity Fair)

summary: Of Wolves and Dragons - Chapter 1 - Dithemo - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Of Wolves and Dragons - Chapter 1 - Dithemo - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 42/42
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Arya Stark/Daenerys Targaryen, Arya Stark & Daenerys Targaryen
Characters: Arya Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Sansa Stark, Jon Snow, Tyrion Lannister
Additional Tags: Romance, Family
Summary:

After ending her time with the Faceless Men, Arya can finally go home. However, with the coming war against the White Walkers, Winterfell might not be safe for long. The Stark’s best option: to ask the Targaryen princess for assistance when she finally wins the throne. Arya isn’t very patient though, so she decides to give the dragon’s army a hand in taking King’s Landing, and maybe cross a few more names off her list while’s she’s at it. Actually crossing Daenerys Targaryes while on her mission wasn’t really her intention, but the Gods sometimes have strange intentions for their people…
